long: Meaning: to "die" (literally or figuratively); causatively, to "kill".  Usage: × at all, × crying, (be) dead (body, man, one), (put to, worthy of) death, destroy(-er), (cause to, be like to, must) die, kill, necro(-mancer), × must needs, slay, × surely, × very suddenly, × in (no) wise.  Source: a primitive root;
